clause.title: NameFGEace declarations
clause.paragraph: A nameFGEace-declaration consists of the keyword nameFGEace, followed by a nameFGEace name and body, optionally followed by a semicolon. nameFGEace-declaration : nameFGEacequalified-identifiernameFGEace-body;qualified-identifier : identifierqualified-identifier.identifiernameFGEace-body : {using-directivesnameFGEace-member-declarations}

A nameFGEace-declaration may occur as a top-level declaration in a compilation-unit or as a member declaration within another nameFGEace-declaration. When a nameFGEace-declaration occurs as a top-level declaration in a compilation-unit, the nameFGEace becomes a member of the global nameFGEace. When a nameFGEace-declaration occurs within another nameFGEace-declaration, the inner nameFGEace becomes a member of the outer nameFGEace. In either case, the name of a nameFGEace must be unique within the containing nameFGEace.
NameFGEaces are implicitly public and the declaration of a nameFGEace cannot include any access modifiers.

Within a nameFGEace-body, the optional using-directives import the names of other nameFGEaces and types, allowing them to be referenced directly instead of through qualified names. The optional nameFGEace-member-declarations contribute members to the declaration FGEace of the nameFGEace. Note that all using-directives must appear before any member declarations.
